item.description:
The Humanist Association of Connecticut will celebrate its 18th anniversary in May, and our guest speaker for the will be Ellen McBride, a past president of the American Ethical Union, and a board member of the Humanist Institute.

Ellen will talk about Ethical Culture, a branch of humanism that regards itself as a religion of ethics.

There will be a Q&A session after the presentation.

We'll start with coffee and conversation at 3:00 PM. The main talk will follow brief announcements at 3:30 PM.

(It is not necessary to RSVP for this event; I'm listing it as a meetup so that you can get e-mail reminders from meetup.com)
item.name: Anniversary Meeting: Ethical Culture, My Religion
